intro: Byrsonima blanchetiana var. subglabra, commonly known as the smooth byrsonima, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves. The plant produces small, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures containing several seeds. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
